alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Fairfield; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Southeastern Orangeburg; Southern Lancaster; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 29 at 2:45PM EDT until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Bamberg, Calhoun, Central Orangeburg, Chesterfield, Clarendon, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lee, Lexington, Northern Lancaster, Northwestern Orangeburg, Richland, Southeastern Orangeburg, Southern Lancaster and Sumter. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall associated with Ian will move into the region tonight and continue across the Midlands on Friday. Rainfall may be heavy at times. Rainfall amounts will range from 3 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Fairfield; Kershaw; Lee; Lexington; Northwestern Orangeburg; Richland; Southeastern Orangeburg; Southern Lancaster; Sumter
